Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>Hey Colin, nice pictures, they look good.  Am I right when I seem to 
>notice more than one recurrent connections on the same link to 
>itself?  (i.e. double loops)  
>  
>
Ahh yes, well spotted. I think the code that checks for duplicate 
connections isn't checking for recurrent connections.

>Also, I think more important than distinguishing strength through 
>color is distinguishing excitatory from inhibitory.  Then strength 
>could be thickness.  If thickness gives too much clutter, you could 
>make the scale of widths very small, like only thickness between 1 
>and 3 or even 1 and 2.
>  
>
Yeh ok I'll try limiting the width by scaling it down to a small range. 
Right now the weights range from -5(blue) to +5(red). 0=turns out to be 
purple on the scale which isn't ideal. I also tried mapping weight to a 
hue in the hue/saturation/brightness system but it generates to many 
colors to be useful.

Colin.
